poem:
Title: "In Whispers of Academic Duel"

Cathedrals of thought raised high, 
discord in hallowed halls, echoes wild.
Two sharp minds, in cold conflict held,
a prig, idle yet dug deep,
a credo etched on phantom page.
In the clash of ink-stained ideals,
bitterness forged, respect crawled unseen.
Their duel, silent yet thunderous,
addled script of Lewis and Betjeman,
a testament to the tug of intellect's tide.
